content.user_title: Create Claude Code slash commands with confidence
content.value_statement: You need reliable guidance to design Claude Code slash commands with the right structure and options. This skill provides clear instructions, examples, and best practices.
actual_capabilities: Explains slash command file locations for project, user, and plugin scopes.
Details YAML frontmatter fields such as description, allowed-tools, model, and argument-hint.
Shows how to use dynamic arguments with $ARGUMENTS and positional values.
Covers file references with @ syntax and bash execution with !` syntax.
Documents plugin command patterns and integration with agents, skills, and hooks.
limitations: Does not execute commands or modify files on your system.
Does not validate your repository specific policies or tooling.
Provides guidance but does not publish or install commands for you.

use_cases.title: Standardize team workflows
use_cases.description: Design consistent project commands with clear frontmatter and arguments for shared team use.

use_cases.title: Build plugin commands
use_cases.description: Create plugin scoped commands with environment variables and multi step workflows.

use_cases.title: Create personal utilities
use_cases.description: Define reusable slash commands for common reviews and documentation tasks.

prompt_templates.title: Basic command setup
prompt_templates.prompt: Show a minimal slash command file and explain where to place it for a project command.

prompt_templates.title: Frontmatter options
prompt_templates.prompt: List the key YAML frontmatter fields for a command and give a short example for each.

prompt_templates.title: Arguments and refs
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a command template that uses $ARGUMENTS, $1, and @file references.

prompt_templates.title: Plugin workflow
prompt_templates.prompt: Design a plugin command that uses ${CLAUDE_PLUGIN_ROOT}, validates inputs, and runs a bash step.

output_examples.input: I need a slash command that reviews code with a description and argument hint.
output: Place the file in `.claude/commands/review.md` for a project command.
Use YAML frontmatter with `description` and `argument-hint` fields.
Write the prompt as instructions to Claude, not a message to the user.

best_practices: Write commands as direct instructions to Claude.
Keep descriptions short and actionable for help listings.
Document arguments with argument-hint to improve discoverability.
anti_patterns: Writing user facing text instead of agent instructions.
Omitting frontmatter when tool access should be restricted.
Using unclear argument formats without examples.

faq.question: Is this compatible with Claude Code and Codex?
faq.answer: Yes. The guidance targets Claude Code slash commands and general command patterns used by Codex.

faq.question: Are there limits on command length or complexity?
faq.answer: This skill does not enforce limits. Check your platform documentation for size and tool restrictions.

faq.question: Can it integrate with plugins and agents?
faq.answer: Yes. It documents plugin command patterns and how to reference agents, skills, and hooks.

faq.question: Does it access or store my data?
faq.answer: No. It provides documentation guidance and does not read or store project data.

faq.question: What if my command does not work?
faq.answer: Review frontmatter fields, argument formats, and file locations. Ensure commands are instructions for Claude.

faq.question: How does it compare to generic prompt guides?
faq.answer: It focuses on Claude Code slash command structure, frontmatter, and plugin specific workflows.
